text: Awesome service.. Tweety is the best nail tech I have ever been to. The quality is surpurb.

name: Melanie Johnson
text: For me, excellent customer service is paramount to anything else.  At Nails and Spa 150, I receive excellent customer service and my nails look great too!  Double win!  Visit them today!

name: Deepali Bajaj
text:
I have been here a total of 5 times and 2 out of 5 experiences were good. Tweety the owner did a fantastic job the 1st time i went in, i was very impressed. However, my last 2 visits have been awful. I went in to get nails for my birthday a mani and pedi. I was there for 4 hours and was told they would and could do a design on my ring finger .My nails were not the length i wanted nor did i get a design they couldn't do it. (Tweetys sister did this). I went back in yesterday for a gel paint on my fingers Tweety's mother said she could do my nails. She tried to force me into a color i did not want after they could not find what i wanted (unorganized). She cured my nails with a gel base coat then tried removing my cuticles. I wanted a matte top coat some of my nails got a shiny coat some got a matte coat. The gel polish was all over my skin on the edges of my nails. It was a mess!! They offered to redo them but i just got them to remove the polish because i was there for 2.5 hours and needed to leave. I came in for a gel paint which is usually 20/30 mins. I understand that this is a family business and that things happen but, some of the girls there are lazy, they don't pay attention to customers or details like they should. They are unorganized and not the cleanest. I was really hoping this would become my permanent nail place but i cant keep wasting time and money to be disappointed.

I think the biggest problem is their lack of professionalism and they aren't nearly attentive enough.

name: Morgan M
text: Finally found a nail salon that I feel comfortable with. I currently use Hannah Mo as my technician and she really pays attention to my needs and takes her time. I have really sensitive skin around my cuticles and nail edges but she works with me to prevent getting cuts or skin tears. I love SNS dip powder and it last forever even though I work in healthcare and i'm constantly washing my hands. The manager Tweety is also great and if I ever have problems she goes over and beyond to make things right.

So my total is 70$ I told her I'm not paying that I sat hear and listen to you lie to a customer about the price reminded her that  I come in here all the  time  I know  the  prices and I told the  lady what they charged Naz wanted to say she giving me a discount no ma'am they are crooks and will beat you out your money if you don't know there prices DO NOT LET THEM STEAL FROM YoU!! text: I had a fantastic experience at Lavish! Jennifer did an amazing job on my highlights. Then I booked my daughter an appointment to have a keratin treatment and Jennifer did an amazing job. My daughter LOVED how her hair turned out. Great place!

name: S B
text: Go see Jennifer Easter at Lavish! I took my two daughters to Lavish for "back to school" haircuts. I had originally booked just one appointment with Jennifer using the online system because only my youngest daughter wanted a cut. The morning of the appointment came, and my oldest daughter decided she wanted her hair done as well. I was afraid they wouldn't be able to squeeze both girls in since it was Saturday. Jennifer and Morgan were very accommodating, and both of my girls got haircuts. They were so kind to my girls! I was so impressed with Lavish that I went back a week later to get my hair cut. Jennifer actually listens to what I want then shapes my hair into that style. I've had my hair cut twice by Jennifer since July. I have been very pleased with each cut and with the level of customer service that Jennifer and Lavish provide. And, bonus points for the ability to schedule appointments online!

name: Jennifer Hunt
text: The people here are amazing. Love my visits with Courtney and the other staff. Not to mention, my hair is awesome!

name: Artisan Assemblage (GeishaGearHart)
text:
My daughter has been using henna for four years and wanted a change.  She wanted to go lighter.  Allie agreed to try and see if that was possible.  Henna is very unpredictable in how it responds.  The fact that she even agreed to try was awesome.

Unfortunately the bleach started having a strange reaction so she washed it out to prevent damage.  Plan B was to just dye it brown and wait for the henna to grow out for a year.

Allie suggested a cut and violet color that turned out perfect.  My daughter loves her hair so much.  Allie worked on her for over 3 hours.  I can not thank her enough for her patience and care.

name: Linda V
text: Abbi is phenomenal.   She was able to fit me in last minute and gave me a BEAUTIFUL cut and style.  I won't go anywhere else.

text: I can’t say enough about this salon!!! Coffee bar, water, hair, nails, massage, facials, and spray tan!?? It’s a nice salon with a laid back feel!! Jennifer Easter is absolutely amazing with cuts and color!! Lifted my level 1 black to blonde with ease!! I’m a hard gal to please and have been a hard client to keep at other salons but 10/10 I definitely recommend!!

She seems to know exactly what I want without having to explain it to her. Lavish Salon has a great atmosphere and I felt immediately welcome. The best stylist and service I have ever received!!

text: If I could leave 0 stars I most definitely would. I’ve been going to this nail shop for almost 4 years and stopped at one point in time due to my nails always breaking as soon as I got them. On 9/8/17 I treated myself to a full set and pedicure (both gel) and not even a week later three nails on one hand were broken. Which is completely ridiculous. I went back to the shop and Mimi told me “we can fix them but you have to pay” “ no one in Huntsville  guarantees anything over 10 days” . That’s absurd. I’ve had full sets for WELL over two weeks before and hadn’t had a nail break. I saw no reason in me paying $15 for repairs when I just spent $100 on my nails not even a week ago. I wouldn’t advise anyone to go to this nail shop. They have very poor customer service and are unprofessional as a whole. One of my friends went to get her eyebrows waxed and the lady messed them up completely and proceeded to have an attitude with my friend for being displeased about her eyebrows. I’m never going back to this poorly managed establishment again and I wouldn’t recommend for anyone else to. Top 10 on Hwy 53 is much better. 🤗

text: My girl loves loves loves this place. I'm not big on spending over 50 bucks for nails but they do a great job and she seems very satisfied when she leaves.however it seems like it takes over an hour every time we're there

name: Lauren R
text:
The best nail salon in the Alabama/Tennessee Valley/Southeast. MiMi has created a Mecca - One Stop Shop and that is why her team is the best!

I have been getting my nails done since I was 12 and I was a patron of this salon from 2015 - 2019. The only reason I stopped was because I moved to Georgia. I was obsessed with my long nails and nobody on campus did them. I came into Mimi’s and said: “Do you use Tammy Taylor acrylic,”she looked back and said “I only use the best baby.” We both laughed. And  I immediately felt at home. I remember my initial visit like it was yesterday: it was a slower day and because I am knowledgeable on products Mimi showed me all the products/options the salon had; I also meet another one of her clients that had long natural nails and she made me feel great as well. Thats when I knew she was an expert and I trusted her.
This is truly the BEST NAIL SALON EVER. A TRUE ONE STOP SHOP: Nails, Waxing, Lashes, Pedicures, Etc.  Every acrylic,polish and service you can think of. The prices are great for services rendered. Mimi has done so well with Sally her oldest daughter and prodigy. I remember the first time she taught Sally how to sculpt nails on my fill in and Sally did excellent on her first try. It’s amazing. This is a hard working family and woman. I have so many memories here!
Like many, I read the reviews at first and was hesitant, but it’s not bad at all. It has gotten better over time. And honestly although many locals would call it a little “ghetto,” this salon has the most hospitality from workers and clients that I have ever seen. Plus the best quality products.
Because of they’re popularity and busyness its best to make an appointment if you want Mimi or Sally.
Pedicures and other simple/quick services performed by the team are great for walk ins.

name: candy mae

text: Everyone at my salon highly recommended Sally and their nails were always on point! After trying for myself, I couldn't be happier! Sally is versatile and exceptionally skilled in the newest trends. I always bring a picture of what I want and she always nails it. I love the shop because they actually talk to you instead of your usual nail shops where you feel like everyone is talking about you the entire time. Her sister also did a wonderful job on mine and my husbands pedicures. It was his first time and she kept us laughing and we left feeling spoiled! Couldn't recommend this nail shop more!

name: Molly Frank
text:
I had acrylics for about two months when I decided to have them taken off for a little while. Half my experiences with getting them redone were terrible let me just say. I must’ve kept getting people who didn’t know at all what they were doing.
I dont know how to add a picture here, but my natural nails are in TERRIBLE condition since I got my acrylics taken off here. This was the first time I’ve been here.
The guy doing it was talking to himself, kept saying “oh my god” over and over, soaked my nails for way longer than he should’ve which I’ve only learned about since I was there. He then used the power tool and drilled almost all the way THROUGH MY NAIL to the skin.
Then he put on gel, which I did not ask for, and when I got up to wash my hands he charged my husband $15 which I would NOT have paid. It’s been close to two months now and my nails are STILL breaking and I have to keep a nail strengthening polish with a top coat on it so that they don’t break as bad.
The only reason my nails didn’t break off in the middle of my nail is because I have a friend who does nails, but not acrylics because they’re bad for your nails, and she was able to help me get the gel off and told me how to properly care for the nails while I have this issue. She also told me this is something that really bad nail solans do called “rings of fire” because the nails burn like fire. Which I can attest to.
Another thing, while he was doing this I jerked my hand out of his, wouldn’t you think this would clue him in? I’ve never experienced this and didn’t realize what happened, I just though the tool was hot on my nail. Silly me. I could not get it off with the %100 acetone remover. I will never go here again.
I would’ve given this no stars but that’s not an option.
Also the gel looked terrible, it had a lot of bubbles throughout and it was coming off my nails as I walked out of the store!

name: Tamia Ellis
text: I had the worst experience at this nail salon. I came in and the owner referred me to an older man(Jack) working in her shop. apparently every worker in the shop knew he was inadequate of performing the task at hand. (a simple fill in) as he is doing my nails he is also watching videos on his phone of how things are made. while in the process he hurt my nails plenty of times. The man applied the thinnest layer on my nails . i had to get a nail replaced and i told him the nail was flimsy after he finished with the acrylic. he told me it would harden after the nail polish was applied. (the nail popped off the next day.) he did not buff or file my nails. when he applied my nail polish he told me to sit under the gel nail dryer. my nails began to bubble up. so i stopped and told him and he asked me which nail and i told him all of them ! he said this is the craziest thing in my life ! i've never saw anything like this in my life ! referring to me not liking my nails. So he had his assistant to fix my nails lord bless her she was kind. but the owner made me feel less of a customer because I wasn't getting gel nails. she said "Its doing that because you have the regular polish, gel polish doesn't do that!" well excuse me but WTF were yall doing before gel polish came out?  don't go to this salon even if its your last resort.

name: Simone
text: I wouldn’t even rate them a 1. Star , this is the nastiest most unprofessional nail place I have ever been to in the city of of Huntsville , al and the way they treat African Americans is pure disgusting . I came to get my nails done and Wednesday@ around 6:30 p.m. , they broke off . I would go back that night To get them fixed up at the nail place but they  closed after 7 pm , so I waited till the next day which was Thursday to get that nail repair . The same guy who died the nail replaced them , well Friday the nail breaks again , So  again so I called before attending there  to speak with management to see what the issue was , and see if they could fix them . The manager knows I drove here from Athens , al which is now my second time fixing after paying $50. The manager Mimi then assured me to come in to get someone else to fix. So I head to the nail place , as I’m walking and I said hey I have already called  can I get my nail repaired , I am told by MIMI DAUGHTER, yes you may have a Seat ....  well after waiting for a while someone else walks in  abs they ask questions regarding prices , and wanting a full set and they sit her down and do her nails .  Then after I ask the daughter how can someone who just arrives get their nails done ahead of a repair that’s been waiting for 30 mins . Then MIMi daughter began to get loud , and argue with me , telling me that I still need to wait , both not seeking any support or understanding of the situation , then she lies and say I have to wait for the same tech to redo my repair , when after speaking on the phone I was told someone else would be doing  it . I was also told that the nail tech who as doing the full set , can’t do a nail repair . What sense does that make ?  (They can do a fill in , but can’t do a nail repair ) Even as I am explaining myself Mimi began to yell at me abruptly in front of customers even after I give her respect . I am a business owner myself , and the respect you receive here is blatant disrespect. I even told the manager I would be leaving a review after the disrespect I received she yells she doesn’t care “ it won’t hurt her “, again this is a business owner speaking to a customer like this . Little do they know I am in the military , and will be sure to spread the word to everyone I know . NOT TO GO TO NAILS BY MIMI , there are way better places who respect there customers . People should watch how they treat others , you never know who your customer is , or who they know , and you can definitely hurt business treating people in such a manner . Again don’t waste your money and attend a better nail salon .

name: A Warren
text:
Service was horrible and has been for a long time . I went and got my nails done myself
Earlier this month for my birthday and 2 days before my birthday two of my nails came COMPLETELY off ! Like the entire acrylic nail came off of my real nail without any damage. I immediately called "Nails by Mimi " to let them know how my nails were coming off , I gave them my name so that when I went to get them refixed , there wouldn't be a problem .. guess what ? There was a problem! Anyways Mimi stepped in and fixed my nails , with a TON OF ACRYLIC . I didn't know the consequences of piling so much acrylic on , So I referred my friends to go to this nail shop. Guess what .. their nails broke too ! My friends went to nails by Mimi to get their nails done before their trip to Japan and while they were over there , their nails broke! My friends called to let them know what was going on so that they could get their nails fixed when they arrived back to the states. Nobody wrote their names down or told Mimi what was going on . When we arrived guess what , THERE WAS A PROBLEM . When we entered the store and my friends started explaining to Mimi what was going on , she pulled out her phone and started recording us 😱 !! She started saying things like " look at them " " look at what I have to deal with " my friends were disgusted and the situation began to get heated . I stood up and addressed Mimi because I was the one who referred my friends and couldn't believe that she was acting this way. I started to address Mimi and reminded her that I was just up here a few weeks ago with the same problem from the same
Nail technician , so my friend's complaint wasn't unusual or unreasonable. I also explained to Mimi that she was profiling my friends and I by instantly pulling her phone out and recording us , when we were only coming to get a service fixed that we had already paid for . Mimi put her phone away and we proceeded on with the encounter. Mimi asked my friends who was the tech that did their nails , they showed her and  The lady who jacked our nails up started speaking in Chinese all angrily and aggressively! Although we could not understand what she was saying , we could tell that she was being agressive and talking trash about us . I told Mimi that the technician was out of line and that as a customer we should not have to deal with her ranting in Chinese or talking about us .. horrible customer service 😡😤. The situation died down and Mimi started to fix my friends nails , she was obviously upset that we articulate what we wanted done and we refused to pay for horrible customer service . Mimi says to us " one monkey don't stop Mimi's show " 😱😱 I was LIKEE WHATTTTT !! I explained to Mimi that yeah one person won't hurt your business but horrible customer services skills and profiling customers will ! I attend Alabama A&M and have told plenty of people to go to Mimi's but NOT anymore ! They rush on your nails and give horrible customer service skills . Your nails will fall off and they will blame it on you , and not on the fact that they use cheap acrylic ! Oh yeah , and if you tell them that you're nails weren't strong enough and broke off  they will slap tons of the cheap acrylic on your nails making them rip your real nails off and leaving you looking like a mutant !

name: Cla'Shawn “LaFay” Booth
text: Horrible experience...As a Nail tech I have worked in this salon for a year and was surprised by the establishment. I had transferred to this location from Madison and I needed a place for my clientele, needless to say it was embarrassing to have my clients travel so far to come in a very run down salon. I made sure that i purchased all my supplies, even towels because the place is flithy. The products were old, pedicure towels smell like mop water and cotton that was used was infested with Rat dropping! Yuck! She uses illegal Acrylic MMA and use unsanitary tools. I had to leave because I could no longer accept the filth and illegal use of products for my clients. This place should be shut down!

text: Friendly and do good work(:

name: Alexandra Allers
text: Absolutely amazing! I made the mistake of trying out a different a different salon on a whim, in which they completely botched my hair. Haley was able to completely color correct my hair and give me a beautiful haircut at a very reasonable price. Would highly recommend this salon to everyone. They definitely take the time out to take care of their guests, and are able to give you the look you’re going for!

name: Kathleen Robinson
text: LOVE this place. I've lived in Birmingham for 6 years and just had bad hair days galore. Melissa COMPLETELY changed that for me. She was awesome - consultative and kind and completely turned my days around. Love the vibe and team here!

name: amanda mcclure
text: Melissa is simply the best! Not only was she intuitive to what I wanted done with my color but she was eager to educate. At 27, I still had questions and false beliefs as to how to make my hair strong, healthy, and beautiful. Melissa took the time to explain. After years of searching for my perfect color, she made it happen!

name: Eric Phillips
text: Always professional; always great services; always hot gossip 😂 Love going here

name: Joey Graham
text: I love Tonya Jones Salon.  I not only get my hair cut there but I also get all my spa services there.  They have great spa therapists, especially Carrie and Jamie.  I love the complimentary extras you get like a hand massage and a killer shampoo.  They also use my favorite products, Aveda.  It always smells so good in there.

name: Patience Gordy
text: Staff is so sweet and helpful! I got a basic cut and style for only $20 plus tip, and I have never been so satisfied with a hair cut. Ms. Tucker was my stylist if you're looking for a recommendation!

name: Emily Finlen
text: I had gone to another salon a few days prior and my hair cut was horrible. Blunt short layers, uneven, and no natural flow after I specifically said I have super straight hair and I do not want to have to do a lot when styling. Luckily I called Tonya Jones and they were able to fit me in where I was extremely satisfied with the customer service up front,  by my stylist, and when looking at products. My hair was perfectly blended with the layers that I had originally wanted. Adrian was amazing and I will be going back to her. She knows her hair and was able to take the mess that I had and gave me exactly what I wanted in the first place, blended layers with a little shape.

name: Koren Ann
text: During my first visit I got a full cut and style, the other stylists were rushing my stylist so they could use the booth, so I was not able to give much feedback or check to make sure I was happy with my style. The second time I visted I got a trim that did not take as long as the first visit. However, they charged the same amount as a full service style. I feel like I was way overcharged for just a trim. Their priority seems to be making money rather than having satisfied, returning customers.

name: Stanley Williams
text:
The front desk staff is FANTASTIC.  Always willing and able to help with my hectic schedule.  I love the tea and relaxed atmosphere when I arrive.  Full service salon/spa but not stuffy at all.

Elizabeth is great.  She is very deliberate and obviously has much passion in her field.  Jamorris is very genteel and gives an incredible massage.  I look forward to returning to get my next haircut and deep tissue massage.

name: Cathy Rogoff
text: Shaun was a fantastic upbeat manicurist!   I do wish there were a more comfy place at Cahaba Village location to put a more comfortable station for Pedicures.

name: Gc Girl
text:
I should have paid more attention to the reviews.  Salon comes off as welcoming and friendly - "complimentary" neck massage.  I use complimentary loosely as I'm not sure if I paid for it or not.  I never saw an itemized bill.  I just know that I was there for 1.5 hours and got all of a ten minute haircut (that's being generous).  Total came to $55 for what amounted to a 1/2" trim and sloppy bang cutting.  No layers (even though layers were discussed).  Stylist hardly spoke at all during entire appointment and I walked out with extremely flat hair with a cowlick in bangs that also have a big chunk that wasn't faded into the overall cut.  She made me feel like I was taking up her time as she had another client in the color room, so I felt uncomfortable and rushed.

When you get your hair cut, you should want to hit the town because you have hair that's only possible after a day at the salon.  I wanted to go straight home and wash my hair to try to regain some movement and style.  Three weeks out and I'm still unhappy and can't wait until I can get my hair cut again - at a different salon.
I should note that I emailed the salon that afternoon to complain about my experience.  On Monday I received a voice mail offering to make things up to me.  I was so upset I didn't know what I wanted to do (I did NOT want Tori touching my hair again and felt very disappointed with the whole Tonya Jones experience).  Made the mistake of waiting two weeks to call the salon back - haven't received any other calls.  At this point I would have offered to pay a percentage of a re-do, but since I haven't been contacted I now feel they don't back up their services so I have no problem leaving this review.

name: Lois McFadyen Christensen
text: Going to Tonya Jones for any service, especially an expert cut by James is a welcome indulgence.  You will certainly be pampered by the best.  Delight in this luxury.

name: Allison Burnett
text: Overpriced disguised as "a la carte" and they charge based on experience of stylist. They change generic words like bathroom and roots to water closet and new growth to make them appear important which will result in you feeling important. I like the color choice even though I'm still scrubbing dye off the area below my hairline. My hair stylist refused to do the cut I wanted and I'm not overly happy with the cut I received. So I'm going to a cheap salon to get it recut today.  Won't return.

name: Lauren B
text: I felt super pampered upon arriving and the little special extra included things were very nice. The staff was very kind, however as others have mentioned, my quote wasn't just inaccurate, they charged me TWICE what my initial quote was. This was frustrating as I specified that my hair was quite long when I called. I asked my hairdresser why it cost so much more than the estimate and she said that hair length and the experience of the hairdresser influence cost. This makes sense but my hairdresser hadn't been out of school even a year!  I don't really see the rationalization for the inflation other than to get people in the chair and know that more than likely they'll just pay rather than schedule an appointment somewhere else.  I will not be going there again as for the price the pampering was nice but the haircut was super meh.

name: Denise Drace
text: Amy colored my hair today and it looks amazing!!  I’m so happy!!  Thank you Amy

name: jordan bruno
text: Excellent service and atmosphere.

name: Cecilia Reisner
text: Very pleased with the customer service! Excellent stylist, as well. Just wish there weren't so many add-ons.

name: Cecilia Reisner

text: Thank you Rodney for an awesome job with my new color tab reviews

name: Ginger L
text: I love my color when Damon does it.  I keep going back so that should say a lot.

name: Emily Green
text: I have been coming to Tonya Jones SalonSpa for a few years now and have been so pleased with the service and results every time. The most courteous and professional salon staff in the greater Birmingham area are at this salon!

name: Allison Brinson
text: Tonya is wonderful gives a amazing haircut. Just don't use the blow-dry bar,  the girl I used had no idea what she was doing, just very disappointed, not what I ask for.

name: Joy E Morris
text:
My experience with Tonya Jones Salon was a horrible one. Not only did the prices continue to rise every single time that I walked through those doors but my hair was completely messed up by the staff (as well as Tonya herself). The day that I went in to have my hair colored was a day that I could forsee myself running late ahead of time. I called and spoke with Tonya herself who told me that it would be ok and to just come on and she would get my hair done. I even stated to her that I would be at the very least 30 mins late. She still stated that was ok. When I arrived 28 mins late and I announced to Tonya that I was there (due to no one being at the front desk at that time) she stated that she already had another customer and that I could see one of her lower tier'd hairdressers. I never like to change hands when it comes to my hair and this story is exactly why I don't.
I was very upset that Tonya told me it would be ok and when she found a higher paying customer she ditched me. However, I decided to go ahead and see her next in line hairdresser who she stated was trained by her and exceptional.
This hairdresser placed the bleach on my hair and after many many minutes I walked up to Tonya to ask if it was time to have the bleach removed. Tonya was irritated and told me that he would come to me when it was ready. Another amount of time goes by and I once again try to find someone to take the bleach out of my hair. After several attempts to have the bleach (foils) removed I was told that the hairdresser had went home! Yes that's right....went home!
Tonya had to call him and have him come back to take the foils out of my hair and to wash the bleach out.
When everything was done and my hair dried, I felt how brittle and dried out my hair was from this session. I mentioned it to Tonya who stated that it was all perfectly normal and to use the "purple shampoo" when I wash my hair the next day and all would be fine.
The next day I did as asked and my hair started to break off in a very big way! I ended going back to Tonya to trim my hair and I asked her to only cut 1/2 inch off the bottom of it. She cut MANY inches off and my hair was no longer long, nor was it healthy any longer. I was truly angry!
Not only did Tonya make me pay for my bad bleaching session which was over $350 but she also made me pay for my horrible trim.
I will NEVER go back to this place as long as I live! I have continued to tell others how bad I was treated and how bad my hair was when it was all said and done.
If you want good service than you will want to go to someone who can give you that. Tonya's salon was not kind to me. When she realized that I didn't have the kind of money that most of her clients had....I feel that's when I was treated much differently.
I would advise going to someone who will treat you right regardless on how much money you are worth or how much money you will spend while at the salon.
Just my experience and my opinion. Hope it helps others out there.
